title: Puerto Rican Sofrito From Scratch
full_text:
Puerto Rican Sofrito From Scratch
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
5 mins
Active
15 mins
Total
5 mins
Serves
32 servings
Makes
4 cups
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
2
medium
Spanish onions
, cut into large chunks (about
2
cups
)
4
cubanelle
peppers
, stemmed, seeded, and cut into large chunks (about
2
cups
)
1
large
red bell pepper
, cored, seeded, and roughly chopped (about
1 1/2
cups
)
4
medium
ripe plum tomatoes
, cored and cut into chunks (about
1 1/2
cups
)
1
large bunch
cilantro
, washed and roughly chopped (about
1 1/2
cups
)
18
medium cloves
garlic
, peeled
8
ajices dulces
, stemmed (see notes)
4
leaves
of
culantro
(see notes)
Kosher salt
Directions
Place onions and cubanelle peppers in workbowl of a food processor fitted with a steel blade. Pulse until coarsely chopped.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
With the motor running, add the remaining ingredients one at a time through the feed tube and process until smooth. Season to taste with salt. Transfer to container and store in refrigerator for up to three days, or freeze.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
Special Equipment
Food processor
Notes
If you can't find ajices dulces, you can omit them. If you can't find culantro, substitute additional cilantro.
Make Ahead and Storage
Sofrito can be frozen up to 3 months.
